description: Of imitative origin. Compare English bang, bounce, bump.

entries.meaning: (informal, countable) A bump on the head.
(informal, countable) Any minor collision or blow.
(informal, countable, chiefly UK) An act of sexual intercourse.
(informal, uncountable) A condition of sudden, severe fatigue in an endurance sports event caused by glycogen depletion.
(countable) An animal call resembling "bonk", such as the call of the pobblebonk.

verbs.description: bonk (third-person singular simple present bonks, present participle bonking, simple past and past participle bonked)

entries.meaning: (informal) To strike or collide with something.
(informal, chiefly UK, transitive, intransitive) To have sexual intercourse (with).
examples: Synonyms: boink, discuss Uganda, have sex; see also Thesaurus:copulate, Thesaurus:copulate with

entries.meaning: (skateboarding, snowboarding) To hit something with the front of the board, especially in midair.
(informal, sports) To experience sudden and severe fatigue in an endurance sports event due to glycogen depletion.
